title: Labour considering ban on sale of energy drinks to under-16s
description: The proposal has been submitted for the party's election manifesto, amid growing evidence of the health risks to young people, Sky News understands. The government previously announced a ban in 2019 but it was not implemented.

title: Rishi Sunak earned more than £2.2m last year
description: Rishi Sunak earned more than £2.2 million last year and paid an effective tax rate of 23 per cent, according to official accounts released on Friday. Downing Street published the Prime Minister’s tax return which showed that in total he paid just over £500,000 in UK taxes in 2022-23.

title: Labour U-turn: Scrapping green pledge about ‘being straight’ with voters, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer insists he scrapped Labour’s £28bn green spending pledge to be straight with voters. With environmental groups, union allies and some of his own MPs expressing disappointment, senior Labour figures have been out presenting a united front as they defend the move.

title: Rift? For Starmer and Reeves, things can only get better, together
description: The Labour leader and his shadow chancellor are desperate to dispel rumours of a row in the wake of their £28bn net-zero reversal. How close are they really?

description: Paddy McGuinness has backed the Mirror's campaign with The BDA to save NHS dentistry following the Top Gear presenter's well-received appearance on Question Time

title: ‘Who does he think he is?’ – Starmer reveals first conversation with wife in Vogue interview
description: Sir Keir Starmer has revealed his wife ended their first conversation by snapping “who the f--- does he think he is?” In an interview with British Vogue, the Labour leader said he didn’t have the “best of starts” with his future spouse, Victoria, as he managed to annoy her straight away.

title: Ed Miliband: I didn't think of quitting over Labour's green U-turn
description: Ed Miliband has insisted he did not consider quitting over Labour's decision to junk its pledge to spend £28bn a year on green projects. Labour's shadow net zero secretary, a key backer of the policy, said the party's plans still met his criteria of "moving the dial" on climate change.

title: Starmer pledges West Midlands gigafactory
description: Sir Keir Starmer said Labour would build a gigafactory in the West Midlands, if the party wins the next general election. Speaking on a visit to Coventry a day after insisting he had no choice but to ditch Labour's £28bn-a-year green investment pledge, he said one of eight new gigafactories in his scaled back proposals would be in the region.

title: ‘S**t politics’: Starmer urged to get his act together after green U-turn
description: Labour needs to be “more clear” and “nimbler” in telling voters how it would govern after abandoning its biggest spending pledge, insiders have urged Sir Keir Starmer. The Leader of the Opposition has insisted that voters “appreciate us being straight” after he scaled back a £28bn-a-year green investment pledge to less than £5bn.

description: The West Midlands "will get a gigafactory" if Labour wins power, the shadow chancellor has claimed.
